structuralFindings.rationale: Mercedes-Benz exhibits a clear hub-and-spoke model with: (1) MBRDNA in Silicon Valley as the 'global AI center' serving as the central hub for AI/autonomous research; (2) Mercedes-Benz Digital Factory Campus in Berlin-Marienfelde as the hub for AI in production/manufacturing; (3) Multiple distributed tech centers globally (Germany, Bangalore, Beijing, Shanghai, Tel Aviv) executing locally with central coordination. The company has centralized standards via MB.OS (the unified operating system) while distributing execution across product teams and geographies. Newly created Chief Data & AI Officer role (May 2025) under 'Global Cyber Security, Data and AI' umbrella signals formal central governance.
structuralFindings.aiTeamStructure:
Multi-hub structure with clear functional specialization:

1. **MBRDNA (Sunnyvale, CA)** - Self-described 'global AI center of Mercedes-Benz' with 600+ employees across 6 North American locations (Sunnyvale, San Jose, Long Beach, Carlsbad, Ann Arbor, Seattle). Focuses on AI experiences, autonomous driving, compute.

2. **Chief Data & AI Officer** - Daniel Eitler appointed May 2025 to new role bundling global cybersecurity, CDO function, and technical management of AI organization under 'Global Cyber Security, Data and AI' umbrella.

3. **Chief Software Officer** - Magnus Östberg leads software organization including MB.OS development. James Liu (Head of MB.OS Customer Experience) reports to him.

4. **Digital Factory Campus (Berlin-Marienfelde)** - Global center for MO360 production technologies, AI in manufacturing, humanoid robotics.

5. **Global Tech Hubs** - Mission control centers in Germany, Bangalore, Beijing, Shanghai, Silicon Valley, Tel Aviv. Shanghai noted as newly developed tech hub over past 3 years.

keyPeople.name: Ola Källenius
keyPeople.title: CEO
keyPeople.role: Overall strategic direction, positioned AI/supercomputing as core to luxury redefinition

keyPeople.name: Daniel Eitler
keyPeople.title: Chief Data & AI Officer (and CISO)
keyPeople.role: Technical management of AI organization, data management, cybersecurity. Appointed May 2025.

keyPeople.name: Magnus Östberg
keyPeople.title: Chief Software Officer
keyPeople.role: Leads MB.OS development, software-defined vehicle strategy, AI integration in vehicle experience

keyPeople.name: James Liu
keyPeople.title: Head of MB.OS Customer Experience
keyPeople.role: Oversees HMI concepts, UX design, front-end engineering, speech, and AI platforms. Reports to CSO.

keyPeople.name: Rashmi Misra
keyPeople.title: Supervisory Board Member
keyPeople.role: External AI expertise on board (Chief AI Officer at Analog Devices, former Microsoft)

structuralFindings.investmentSignals: Double-digit billion euros per year in R&D, tooling, and manufacturing - described by Källenius as 'investing at the highest level in the history of the company.' 2025 investment to be peak before decline in 2026. 600+ employees at MBRDNA alone. Free cash flow of €4.2B in Q2 2025, net cash position of €30B. Academic partnerships funded at Stanford and UC San Diego for AI/autonomous driving research.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: Chief Data & AI Officer reports within tech/IT organization. Chief Software Officer (Magnus Östberg) appears to be a top executive overseeing vehicle software and AI integration. AI expertise added to supervisory board (Rashmi Misra).
observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: Significant ring-fenced investment in MBRDNA as dedicated global AI center (600+ headcount). Separate Digital Factory Campus for manufacturing AI. Dedicated partnerships with Google, Microsoft, Nvidia, Momenta, ByteDance, Tencent. Academic funding for Stanford and UCSD.
observableMarkers.timeHorizons: Mixed horizons: Near-term (2026-2027) for CLA and S-Class with MB.OS. Medium-term for L4 autonomous/robotaxi capabilities with Uber/Nvidia partnership. Long-term fundamental research via academic partnerships. Clear product launch cadence driving AI integration timeline.
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Centralized architectural decisions via MB.OS platform (replaces fragmented third-party ECU approach). Distributed execution at global tech hubs. Central standards with local adaptation (especially China partners like Momenta, ByteDance, Tencent).
observableMarkers.metrics: Explicit focus on processing power (508 TOPs for MB Drive Assist Pro, '5x Tesla FSD'). Over-the-air update capability as key milestone. Privacy compliance as differentiator. Q2 2025 earnings focus on EBIT, ROS, and free cash flow rather than AI-specific metrics.

quotes.text: From this point forward, every Mercedes will have a supercomputer in it. Every Mercedes will have a full sensor suite.
quotes.speaker: Ola Källenius
quotes.context: Media roundtable discussing Google Gemini integration into MBUX

quotes.text: So you have your own butler in the car.
quotes.speaker: Ola Källenius
quotes.context: Describing AI integration with supercomputing and virtual assistants managing LLMs in real time

quotes.text: The old paradigm...that approach is completely over.
quotes.speaker: Ola Källenius
quotes.context: Describing shift from integrating third-party ECUs to proprietary supercomputer architecture

quotes.text: Agility and speed are no longer advantages. They are requirements.
quotes.speaker: Ola Källenius
quotes.context: Discussing MB.OS enabling faster iteration and shorter feedback loops

quotes.text: You need to have an adventurous OEM that is willing to push the boundaries.
quotes.speaker: Ola Källenius
quotes.context: Discussing Mercedes' pioneering role in AI integration

quotes.text: If you're in a Mercedes, you're fully and totally inside the Mercedes world.
quotes.speaker: Ola Källenius
quotes.context: Discussing privacy framework and Google's commitment not to share personal data

quotes.text: When a query comes in, the Mercedes operating system will determine whether Gemini or ChatGPT will handle determining the answer.
quotes.speaker: Ola Källenius
quotes.context: Explaining how MB.OS routes AI queries between competing LLMs

quotes.text: It marks the beginning of a new era for Mercedes-Benz and for our customers: The CLA will be the most efficient and the most intelligent Mercedes we've ever made.
quotes.speaker: Ola Källenius

quotes.text: Software and AI are fitted to equation of luxury by elevating the rest of the vehicle.
quotes.speaker: Magnus Östberg
quotes.context: Explaining how AI redefines luxury in automobiles

quotes.text: We continuously improve and continuously learn. That is the most important lesson.
quotes.speaker: Magnus Östberg
Ola Källenius
quotes.context: Comparing ChatGPT integration to Iron Man's AI assistant

summary: Mercedes-Benz operates a sophisticated hub-and-spoke AI structure with MBRDNA in Silicon Valley as its self-designated 'global AI center' (600+ employees) and the Berlin Digital Factory Campus as its manufacturing AI hub. The May 2025 appointment of Daniel Eitler as the first Chief Data & AI Officer signals formal centralization of AI governance. CEO Källenius has framed AI as the redefinition of luxury, declaring 'every Mercedes will have a supercomputer in it,' while investing 'double-digit billion euros per year' in R&D. The proprietary MB.OS platform centralizes architectural standards while enabling distributed execution across global tech hubs in Germany, China, India, Israel, and North America.
openQuestions: Exact headcount of AI-focused engineers globally (only MBRDNA's 600+ is specified)
Organizational relationship between CDAIO Daniel Eitler and CSO Magnus Östberg - do they share AI responsibility?
Budget allocation specifically for AI vs. broader software/R&D
Status of CES 2026 Alpamayo 1 VLA (Vision-Language-Action) model - no details found in search results
Specific team structure and leadership within MBRDNA's AI organization
Decision-making process between central AI governance and regional hubs (especially China)
Whether the 'Global Cyber Security, Data and AI' umbrella includes product AI (MB.OS) or only enterprise AI
conferenceFindings: No specific details found about the CES 2026 Alpamayo 1 VLA model mentioned in the scan context. Search results focused on MB.OS, Google Gemini/ChatGPT integration, and the 2026 CLA launch. The VLA model may be a pre-announcement or less publicized development. Would benefit from searching specifically for 'Alpamayo' or Mercedes CES 2026 keynote coverage.
